roles.title: Software Engineer
roles.description: Designs, develops, tests, and maintains software systems and applications; collaborates with cross-functional teams to deliver reliable software solutions. Often involved with the full development lifecycle. :contentReference[oaicite:1]{index=1}
roles.notes: Indian salaries vary by company and city; big tech product roles pay more. :contentReference[oaicite:2]{index=2}

roles.title: Web Developer
roles.description: Builds and maintains websites and web applications, focusing on front-end, back-end, or full-stack development. Often works with UI/UX designers and back-end services. :contentReference[oaicite:3]{index=3}
roles.notes: Web development pay varies widely by specialization (front-end vs full-stack vs back-end).

roles.title: AI Engineer
roles.description: Designs and implements AI/ML models, builds production-ready AI systems, works on neural networks, LLMs, computer vision, or AI automation. Requires strong ML fundamentals. :contentReference[oaicite:4]{index=4}
roles.notes: AI roles can command higher pay than general software roles due to specialized skill demand. :contentReference[oaicite:5]{index=5}

roles.title: Data Scientist
roles.description: Extracts insights from large datasets, builds predictive models, and interprets analytics results to support business decisions. Often works with ML & statistical techniques. :contentReference[oaicite:6]{index=6}
roles.notes: Data scientists often earn more than data analysts due to ML expertise. Advanced degrees/PhDs can raise pay further. :contentReference[oaicite:7]{index=7}

roles.title: Data Analyst
roles.description: Works with data to clean, interpret, visualize, and report insights that help business decision-making. Focuses on descriptive analytics rather than predictive modelling. :contentReference[oaicite:8]{index=8}
roles.notes: Data analysts often progress into data science and business analytics positions. :contentReference[oaicite:9]{index=9}
